tutorial.title: Social Media Profile
tutorial.descriptionContent: Create your very own social media profile page

executableContent.instructions:
Let's use our HTML knowledge to create a small page that mimics a social media profile. 

We start by putting together a basic HTML page template. You won't see anything rendered in the preview below and that's ok; we'll start adding visible content soon.


1. Code a `!doctype html` element.
2. Code an `html` element.
3. Code a `body` element.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Let's give our webpage a title.

Since our preview browser below doesn't have a title bar, you won't be able to see our title. But setting webpage titles is an important best practice to follow.

1. Code a `head` element.
2. Set the page's title to `Profile`.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
We want to display both the user's real name and their username on their profile. 

The name should stand out through its size, so we'll use HTML heading elements to differentiate between the name and username.


1. Code an `h1` element and write your name inside it.
2. Code an `h2` element beneath your name to display a username of your choosing, like `@alwaysjudging`.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions: To make the profile more realistic, we need to add a few elements that you may or may not have seen before. Don't worry, you'll learn all about these new elements soon enough. For now, we'll just copy and paste them into our code. 1. Within the `head` element, add the following code snippet: ``` ``` 2. Within the `body` element, before the headings you've created, add the following code snippet: ``` ```

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Users should be able to log out and navigate from their profile page to the home page or their direct messages. 

We'll use links to add these navigation options. Since we haven't yet created the pages we're linking to, we'll link to an "under construction" page.

1. Above the `img` element, code a link with the text `Home`.
2. Since we haven't implemented the Home page yet, link to the Mimo page at `https://mimo.org` when users click the `Home` text.
3. Code a second link with the text `DMs` and the same URL.
4. Code a third link with the text `Logout` and the same URL.
5. Add a line break after the `Logout` link

files.name: index.html
files.solvedContent:
Home DMs Logout

Lucien Dubois

@alwaysjudging

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Next, we'll use links and emphasis elements to add an "about" section to the user's profile and make it stand out.

1. Code a paragraph after the `h2` element.
2. Copy and paste this text inside your new paragraph element:
`Freelance maker and dabbler. Love building things. Currently working on this neat little project.`
3. Add emphasis to the entire text snippet you just added within the paragraph element.
4. Make the text `neat little project` a link that directs to a website of your choice.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Home DMs Logout

Lucien Dubois

@alwaysjudging
files.solvedContent:
Home DMs Logout

Lucien Dubois

@alwaysjudging

Freelance maker and dabbler. Love building things. Currently working on this neat little project.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Let's continue the "about" section with some fields for the user's current location, as well as their webpage, where others can check out their projects.

1.  Below the paragraph you just added, code a second paragraph element.
    - set its text to `Where:` followed by some location (feel free to make something up)
    - code a `strong` element around `Where:` to make it stand out
2.  Code a third paragraph element.
    - set its text to `Webpage:` followed by some web address (feel free to make something up)
    - code a `strong` element around `Webpage:` to make it stand out
    - link the web address somewhere using the `href` attribute

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Home DMs Logout

Lucien Dubois

@alwaysjudging

Freelance maker and dabbler. Love building things. Currently working on this neat little project.

Webpage: lucienthegreat.com

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Like with any social media profile, we need to display some information about the user's activity. We'll add some links to the user's posts, followers, and following list. 1. Below the paragraphs you just added, code a link that also links somewhere, with the text `274 Posts`. 2. Code a second link that directs to the same URL, with the text `500 Followers`. 3. Code a third link that directs to the same URL, with the text `174 Following`. 4. Add a break `
` after each link.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
To help users connect with each other more easily, we'll add some buttons to the profile page.

Since the rest of the website is still under construction, we won't attach any action to the buttons.

1. Code a button element under the `174 Following` link.
2. Make the button display `Reach out`.
3. Make the button's text stand out by surrounding the text with `strong` tags.

1. Code a second button that displays `Follow`.
2. Code a third button that displays `Report`.
